newsitem.title: USA: AIG Q1 general insurance net premiums up.
newsitem.headline: AIG Q1 general insurance net premiums up.

text.p: American International Group Inc said first quarter worldwide general insurance net premiums written totalled $3.31 billion, up six percent from a year earlier after the impact of foreign exchange.
Excluding the foreign exchange impact, worldwide general insurance net premiums written rose 8.1 percent.
The combined ratio improved to 96.25 percent in the first quarter from 96.79 percent a year ago, AIG said.
Domestic net premiums written, excluding the risk management business, rose 12.3 percent, AIG said.

"This was a very good quarter for AIG, as we reported solid growth in all of our major business areas -- general insurance, life insurance and financial services," AIG Chairman Maurice Greenberg said.
However, he said, "The U.S. market for commodity lines continues to be under price pressures and there still exists too much capacity in terms of capital in the property-casualty field.
"Hence risk selection remains a key AIG priority."

Greenberg said AIG announced this quarter a realignment of its domestic brokerage group. The realignment will allow the group to focus more sharply on the needs of its major customer groups, "including middle market commercial accounts, an area in which we foresee substantial growth opportunities," he said.
The growing domestic personal lines business had a quarter of solid gains and increased profitability, he said.
International property-casualty had an excellent quarter, with strong underwriting results throughout the Foreign General Group.
Excluding the impact of foreign exchange, net premiums written increased by 8.0 percent.
AIG said its United Guaranty Corp mortgage guaranty insurance subsidiary had a strong quarter, with very good growth in net premiums written and operating income.
General insurance pretax income before realized capital gains for the first quarter was $569.9 million, an increase of 14.3 percent compared to $498.5 million last year.
General insurance net investment income rose 10.1 percent to $451.1 million from $409.5 million.
